byline.original: By MICHAEL CORKERY and MARY WILLIAMS WALSH

abstract: Obama administration says no federal bailout will be offered to Puerto Rico in response to Gov Alejandro Garcia Padilla's warning that commonwealth cannot pay $72 billion in debt, but offers support for congressional effort to extend bankruptcy protections; effort faces strong opposition from Republicans in Congress, and debate could affect 2016 elections.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration said no federal bailout would be coming, but expressed support for a Democrat-led effort in Congress to extend Chapter 9 protection to some of the island’s public entities.

headline.main: Puerto Rico Debt Crisis Splits Congress on Party Lines and Draws Muted Response From White House
headline.print_headline: Puerto Rico’s Crisis Draws Split in Congress and Muted White House Reply

snippet: The Obama administration said no federal bailout would be coming, but expressed support for a Democrat-led effort in Congress to extend Chapter 9 protection to some of the island’s public entities.
